name: TheAtlantic
text: "As every experienced federal prosecutor would immediately understand, Barr’s position violates Department of Justice lawyers’ training, their obligations to the court ... and the equal application of the law to all," @AWeissmann_ writes: https://t.co/9uaNq54DpK

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A great many people seem to think Trader José is just a little joke, rather than a bark of white supremacy," @JohnHMcWhorter writes: https://t.co/JNhXMtAUCj

name: TheAtlantic
text: The human immune system is very complicated. (No, seriously, it's really very complicated.) And it's the key to answering some of the most pressing questions about how the pandemic will play out over the next months and years, @edyong209 writes: https://t.co/ql3QNBhMSO

name: TheAtlantic
text: The photographer Adraint Khadafhi Bereal created “The Black Yearbook” to show the highs and lows of Black life at a predominantly white college, @AdamHSays writes. https://t.co/g5WqDoLpcQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: “For the first time in a long time, I don’t think it really makes sense for me to have children; the future is too uncertain and the current environment too unsafe,” writes @TheSamhita: https://t.co/NJQQtUZrbr

text: The Atlantic Daily: 5 Ways America Has Failed During the Pandemic, by @mimbsy https://t.co/y99qcAofvP

name: TheAtlantic
text: Los Angeles has an ambitious program to use tree-planting as an axis to connect job-creation, climate sustainability, urban renewal, and economic equity and inclusion, @JamesFallows writes: https://t.co/GzdW4fBp8g

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to Senator Chris Coons discuss a Civilian Conservation Corps for the pandemic era on the "Social Distance" podcast. https://t.co/KjFGPJ9DJm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Domestic-violence refuges are one of feminism's great successes. But have we become too hung up on "rescuing" victims, asks @helenlewis, and what can we offer women who won't leave their partners? https://t.co/YwkRDxwJqG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
One year ago, India revoked Kashmir’s autonomous status, throwing the region into lockdown.

“It wasn’t always a bad relationship with the army,” a young Kashmiri told @anchalvohra last fall. “Now I see them as an enemy." https://t.co/WhW7kOMgk7

name: TheAtlantic
text: “If we lock them away with no trial, we make them living martyrs. If we make the boneheaded decision to execute them, then they become dead martyrs.” The families of ISIS's victims are asking for justice, @gcaw reports: https://t.co/zEKO9B5bo3

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Just as the 1850s paved the way for the revolution against slavery, Trump’s presidency has paved the way for a revolution against racism.” The latest Atlantic Daily, from @mimbsy: https://t.co/RLG9gcifld

text: What will Joe Biden do as president? The pandemic has made it almost impossible to go deep on details, @IsaacDovere reports. https://t.co/qP3gZXRlnn

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There’s reason to believe that such vocal calls for change from corporations could actually be worse than meaningless—and in fact damage the chances that corporations will follow through on meaningful change," Jerry Useem writes: https://t.co/c5b9S1bNLz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: The central idea behind this piece on why the US failed so badly to control the pandemic is that it fell under the combined weight of a multitude of weaknesses, every one of which was predictable. 

I want to unpack that idea. 

A thread. 1/

https://t.co/568JBkbBge

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "The remedies that have proved effective in wealthy nations haven’t necessarily been possible in poorer ones—particularly those with inadequate testing capacity, strained health-care systems, and limited social safety nets." https://t.co/H2UiXrUCQJ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Vice President Mike Pence called Chief Justice John Roberts a “disappointment” to conservatives last night.

To the frustration of Republican activists, right-leaning justices have consistently moved left once on the bench, @EmmaOGreen wrote in July. https://t.co/NuU2HbdGDV

name: TheAtlantic
text: The allegations of abuse at Ellen DeGeneres’s talk show have the feeling of a reckoning. But a reckoning about what? @skornhaber on the reality-distortion field of fame: https://t.co/xAfFS6TOMw

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As the economy reopens while the coronavirus spreads, hundreds of thousands of workers are getting back to work, but with less work than they want, need, and used to have," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/H2EFe9Bxsa

name: TheAtlantic
text: It's been decades since doctors regularly made house calls, and they're finding upsides to the more intimate view of their patients' lives they get from video calls, @MarionRenault reports: https://t.co/5mnsBl4mrF
